name: Cod Ceviche
description: Ceviche makes a light, satisfying meal. I like to serve it over a bed of spinach. You can begin the dish in the morning and the fish will be ready by dinnertime.
keywords: dairy-free, gluten-free, halal, healthy, high fiber, kosher, low sugar, nut-free, fall, spring, summer, winter
recipeIngredient: 1 small white or red onion, sliced
1 or 2 serrano or jalapeño chiles, minced

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the fish into 1/2-inch cubes. Make sure to pull out any bones and discard. Place in a large bowl, add the lime juice and stir together. Make sure that the fish is covered with lime juice. Cover and refrigerate for 6 to 7 hours, stirring every once in awhile.

Add salt and pepper to taste, and toss together. Add the onion, garlic, chiles, tomatoes if using, and olive oil, and toss together. Cover and refrigerate for another hour. Stir in the avocado and cilantro and gently toss together.

Line plates or wide bowls, or a platter with the spinach leaves. Taste the ceviche and adjust seasoning. Using a slotted spoon so that your plate doesn’t become flooded with lime juice, top the spinach with the ceviche and serve.
